Title: Team Formation Activities
Description: Looking for a team? Want to make new friends? Do not miss this opportunity to socialize with fellow TTNY hackers, bond over your shared love of coding and other hobbies, and form your hackathon dream team!

Title: Introduction to HTML & CSS
Description: During this workshop, hackers will use CodPen to create a simple "portfolio" website using HTML and CSS. Hackers will finish off by creating a GitHub repository and uploading their code to the repo.

Title:
Using Django to Build a Web-App with
a Data-Focused Back End
Presented by MASSMUTUAL
Description: Want to build a web app, but don't know where to start? Come learn about Django, a python web framework that makes building web apps easier than ever. Led by a jr. data scientist at MassMutual, the talk introduces how web apps work and walks through a Django web app tutorial. The tutorial builds an end-to-end Django web app which integrates a simple machine learning model. Prerequisite: no prior experience with Django or machine learning is needed, but some exposure to Python is helpful. More information can be found here: https://github.com/katiehouse/django-scikit-learn-tutorial

Title: Demystifying Desktop Applications
Description:
In this hands on workshop, attendees will be introduced to Electron.js and they will learn to build their first cross platform desktop application using basic web technologies.
Before the workshop, please have Node.js and any Text Editor (e.g. VSCode) installed.

Title: Introduction to JavaScript
Description:
This workshop introduces the foundational JS syntax then shows brief examples of how they can be used. Attendees have the opportunity to apply the JS syntax in a repl.it, where you'll practice boolean operators in if statements, print out general statements, do mathematical operations, and make a premade webpage interactive.
Please make an account with repl.it before the workshop.

Title: Introduction to Python
Description: In this workshop, hackers will learn the basics of python coding and how it correlates to an input and output standpoint creating digital art. The goal is to inspire attendees to code and create a social impact through computer science!

Title: Interview Preparation
Description: Through this workshop we’ll show you how to break down a job description, prepare questions for the interviewers, how to approach answering interview questions, and go over tips and tricks for staying focused.  You’ll also walk away with a free digital “to-do list” for the morning of your interview.

Title: Introduction to Node.js and Express.js
Description:
This workshop will introduce hackers to the basics of Node.js and Express.js so that hackers can set up a local server for prototyping web applications and building backend APIs.
Before the workshop, please have Node.js installed.

Title: Introduction to Ren.js
Description:
Attendees will learn how to build visual novel games in the RenJS framework.
Please have a text editor installed before the workshop.

Title:
Crush Your Coding Interview
Presented by FACEBOOK
Description: This workshop will provide preparation tips for technical interviews and will conclude with information about Facebook's recruiting process.

Title: Offer Negotiation
Description: During this workshop we’ll walk through the aspects of a job offer, understanding how companies put together a package, and go over benefits. Then we’ll teach you how to negotiate with a recruiter and how to ask for your compensation requirements. You’ll leave with a free digital guide to use for every offer presented to you - so you can stay focused while doing the “I got an offer!” happy dance.

Title:
Ethics and Governance in Artificial Intelligence
Presented by MASSMUTUAL
Description: The rapidly growing capabilities and increasing presence of AI-based systems in our lives raise pressing questions about the impact, governance, ethics, and accountability of these technologies. Some of the questions to think about are: How do we create trust in the decision making of these AI- systems and not make black boxes? How do we harness the potential of AI systems while ensuring that they do not exacerbate existing inequalities and biases, or even create new ones? How can we narrow the knowledge gap between AI “experts” and the variety of people who use, interact with, and are impacted by these technologies?

Title: Introduction to Data Analytics
Description: In this workshop we will be using R to conduct data analysis and produce data visualizations based on census data. We will be looking at linear regression and five-number summaries as well as creating bar charts, scatter plots, and histograms.

Title: Introduction to AWS
Description: The AWS talk will introduce cloud computing, computing architectures, serverless computing, and the services offered by AWS (Compute, Storage, and APIs). No prior experience with cloud computing is required.  Students who attend the talk will get AWS credit!
